preface.title: OpenStack API Reference
preface.para: The OpenStack system has several key projects that are separate installations but can work together depending on your cloud needs: OpenStack Compute, OpenStack Object Storage, OpenStack Identity Service, and OpenStack Image Service.

This page covers the basics for working with your OpenStack cloud through the Compute API and Image API after authorizing with the Identity Service API. You can build a cloud by launching images and assigning metadata to instances, all through an API. See the API Quick Start Guide for details about using the APIs referenced here, and go to docs.openstack.org/api for specifications of each API.

chapter.title: Identity
chapter.para: With the Identity API, you obtain a token that lasts 24 hours so you can gain access to the Compute API. The version of the Identity API is 2.0.

chapter.title: Compute
chapter.para: With the Compute API, you launch virtual machines based on the images uploaded to the system. You can reboot the server when needed, resize it larger or smaller, and connect to the server securely through SSH once it is started. The v1.1 API is identical to the v2 API.

chapter.title: Compute API Extensions
chapter.para: An extension adds capabilities to an API beyond those defined in the core API. The introduction of new features, MIME types, actions, states, headers, parameters, and resources can all be accomplished by means of extensions to the core API. You can query the Compute API to find out which extensions are available with a GET request to v1.1/extensions.

section.title: Disk Config
section.para: Extends servers and images with a diskConfig attribute.

section.title: Server - Extended Create
section.para: Provides extra information when creating a server.

section.title: Server Rescue
section.para: Rescues and unrescues a server.

section.title: Server Console Output
section.para: Gets the output from the console log for a server.

section.title: Server VNC Console
section.para: Accesses a VNC console for a specific server.

section.title: Extended Instance Status
section.para: Adds vm_state, task_state, and power_state to detailed server responses.

section.title: Extended Server Attributes
section.para: Adds additional metadata to servers detail and show response.

section.title: Server Start/Stop
section.para: Starts and stops a server.

section.title: Server Force Delete/Restore
section.para: When Nova is deployed with deferred delete on, restores or forces the deletion of a server.

section.title: Floating IPs
section.para: The Floating IPs extension enables assigning and allocation of floating IP addresses to instances running in an OpenStack cloud.

section.title: Floating IP Pools
section.para: Manages groups of Floating IPs.

section.title: Floating IP DNS
section.para: The Floating IP DNS extension provides an interface for managing DNS records associated with IP addresses allocated by the Floating Ips extension. Requests are dispatched to a DNS driver selected at startup.

section.title: Networks
section.para: The Networks extension allows you to view and delete networks. It also provides an action to disassociate a network from a project if you are using vlan mode.

section.title: Scheduler Hints
section.para: Provides information directly to the scheduler when creating a server.

section.title: Keypairs
section.para: Generates, imports, and deletes SSH keys..

section.title: Simple Usage
section.para: Reports stats on compute and storage resources.

section.title: Security Groups
section.para: Creates, modifies, and deletes security groups and rules.

section.title: Cloudpipe
section.para: Manages virtual vpns for projects.

section.title: Hosts
section.para: Manages physical hosts.

section.title: Flavor Management
section.para: Creates and deletes flavors.

section.title: Flavors - Extra Data
section.para: Allows extra attributes to be returned with flavor objects. This includes 'swap', 'rxtx_factor' and 'OS-FLV-EXT-DATA:ephemeral'.

section.title: Host Aggregates
section.para: Allows the creation and management of host aggregates (such as pools of compute nodes).

section.title: Virtual Interfaces
section.para: Enables listing of Virtual Interfaces of running instances.

section.title: Volume Attachments
section.para: Enables you to attach volumes created through the volume API to server instances. You can also list volume attachments for a server instance, get volume details for a volume attachment, and delete a volume attachment.

chapter.title: Image
chapter.para: Loads images for use at launch time by the Compute API. Some cloud implementations do not expose this API and offer pre-tested images only. You can also assign metadata to images with this API.

chapter.title: Volume
chapter.para: Allows you to manage volumes and snapshots that can be used with the Compute API.
